name: hello-world-cpp
description: A simple C++ Hello World plugin demonstrating the G-Assist C++ SDK and JSON-RPC V2 protocol

functions.name: say_hello
functions.description: Greet the user with a personalized hello message. Use this when the user wants a greeting or says hello.

name.description: The name of the person to greet. If not provided, defaults to 'World'.

functions.name: count_with_streaming
functions.description: Count from 1 to a specified number, demonstrating streaming output. Use this when the user wants to see a counting demonstration.

count_to.description: The number to count to (1-20). Defaults to 5.

functions.name: start_conversation
functions.description: Start an interactive conversation session. Use this when the user wants to have a back-and-forth chat.

topic.description: The topic the user wants to discuss. Defaults to 'anything'.
